channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Billionaires Back a New 'Anti-Woke' University
item.description: Jeff Yass and Harlan Crow are among donors for school that touts a “fearless pursuit of truth.”

item.title: ‘I want the calls and letters to stop’: My mother died owing $17,000 in credit-card debt. The creditors want their money. Will I have to sell her house?
item.description: “My mom passed away in May from Alzheimer’s. I was her primary caretaker.”

item.title: She's a Retirement Authority---and Still Made Mistakes. Here's What She'd Do Differently.
item.description: Alicia Munnell, who is stepping down as director of Boston College’s Center for Retirement Research, reflects on her own retirement planning.

item.title: ‘She can’t even buy groceries or put gas in her car’: My friend’s husband died, leaving her with three young children, no job and $15,000 in credit-card debt
item.description: “She is planning to sell their house and should net between $75,000 and $100,000 on the sale of the property.”

item.title: ‘This money is not bringing me a lot of happiness’: My husband and I have $7 million, but our kids are trouble. Should we cut them off?
item.description: “His son and his wife are not good to us. We rarely see them and they never offer to help us with anything.”

item.title: Tesla Leaves Uber Plenty of Road
item.description: Elon Musk’s brief Cybercab unveiling doesn’t hurt the case for the ride-booking operator’s key role in the robotaxi business.

item.title: ‘This was a money grab’: My uncle took over the family business — and left my father out in the cold. Can I claim our inheritance?
item.description: “When my grandfather passed away, my uncle continued running the business and, at that point, he decided that my father would not receive any financia...

item.title: Want a Crypto-Friendly Congress? Run Ads That Don't Mention Crypto
item.description: A trio of crypto-funded super PACs spent $62 million on video ads last month that never mentioned digital currencies.

item.title: Storms Are Reshaping Florida's Insurance Market. Here's What to Know.
item.description: Home insurance in Florida is an unusual patchwork, reliant on small to midsize carriers and several layers of state support.

item.title: Netflix results are due. Wall Street wants it to raise prices
item.description: Ahead of Netflix’s NFLX results on Thursday, Wall Street was wondering about something that would have a more immediate financial impact to its viewer...
